protein.specific_function: Calcium-regulated, actin-modulating protein that binds to the plus (or barbed) ends of actin monomers or filaments, preventing monomer exchange (end-blocking or capping). It can promote the assembly of monomers into filaments (nucleation) as well as sever filaments already formed

reference.reference_text: Kwiatkowski DJ, Stossel TP, Orkin SH, Mole JE, Colten HR, Yin HL: Plasma and cytoplasmic gelsolins are encoded by a single gene and contain a duplicated actin-binding domain. Nature. 1986 Oct 2-8;323(6087):455-8.
